column5: Same for me, YellowBoat, five nights on Opeongo, chasin dem lakers.  Where are you going?  You might be able to drop in for a smart cocktail.
Only 6 sleeps now Assuming the ice melts...
I'll be on the east side of the park. Thanks for the offer though.

Cookslav nice one. It looks like the same place you went last year.  I am in at the end of the month. Can't wait.  Nice cookin' shots as well.  Great to see the no trace shot. If everyone left it as good or maybe even a bit better well you know...    Motorhead Steelback was specifiaclly designed fo APP as it is in plastic and therefore legal in the Park. Like anything else though you have to pack out the trash.
I think steelback bottles are plastic, not too sure tho!
That's a great read!  Thanks for taking the time to share!!  dk
Awesome post!  Cheers  Jen
Awesome report and pics. Thanks
Well done guys, beautiful spot
Great report... Glad to see you had a good couple days and caught some fish while you were out enjoying yourself... Thanks for sharing that with us
Must have been nice!  Thanks for sharing every minute of your awesome adventure with us! I enjoyed it very much!
Thanks for your report and pics.  Fresh trout in the park are the sweetest.
Exellent report, one of the best of the year,Thanx. Joe
Excellent report... awesome pic's too...  Thanks for sharing....
Great report, sweet pics and nice fish. Thanks for sharing that!
Excellant report and great pictures!! I have never been to Algonquin but it looks prestine! Unfortunately, I am not much of a portager.
Amazing how thet one Rock ledge had a ton a boats already there. Fun report.

Hey guys, Sorry for the late Response, but I've been swamped at work...catching up from the trip LOL Thanks for the kind words.  Badger, I just use maps purchased from the Park...they are very acurate and easy to use. No issues with wild life "yet".... However...we did startle a bear on our way through a portage. Right at the begining we just heard something take off through the bush(didn't see it) But the Shore line was riddled with tracks, and over turned rocks....looking for grubs I assume?  Charlied, That was my 6th time back to the same area... I found it with a freind and have been going back every year since. but I've been through many other areas of the park in the past as well. This is actualy a fairly easy jaunt suitable for an 11 year old, and some older (Mobility challenged) Men LOL... But there are great trip routes, and canoe route maps you can purchase through the Park for trip planning. I have an older slightly less acurate downloadeable PDF map if your interested in it just PM me.  You know Irish?...I didn't recall see rusty this year,  guess I might need to widdle him next year LOL...  Nemo, Your right it was the same spot...I'm trying to talk the group into going a bit further in next year to another lake thats "rumored" to be good, but we'll see(the guys are pretty attached to the area) Good luck with your trip in!  Motorhead, Nemo is bang on....Steelback is distibuted in a plastic bottle   Big swede, Anytime yuou want a reunion tour I'm in...I can put us on fish if your willing to go for a hike, but no promises on the moss. Cheers
In the spirit of Nemos request I'll bump my own Algonquin report from last year Only 7 sleeps and I'm back in the Pines!!! Different spot this year though....so much Park so little time
I'm jealous can't wait for that report.  Nemo

I do a lot of camping, but have yet to make it up to Algonquin.  This report however gives me some added incentive.  If I can I might head to Frontenac Park in the next couple weeks.  They have a couple of small lakes that are (or at least were) stocked with Splake, but the lakes are very small and very deep and hard to get to, so I'm not sure what kind of presentation to use.  Good luck on your trip this year!
I can't wait to get back out there!
Super stuff..you guys are living the dream life!
great report and beauty pics! thanks for sharing!
GREAT REPORT. i WILL BE DOING THE EXACT SAME IN EXACTLY A MONTH. IM SUPER EXCITED! THANKS FOR THE REPORT!! I WILL PM
Love it!  That was great. Now I really gotta get my crap together and get out of here!  Thanks
I am fairly new to this board, I don't understand the ps?
A week and 2 days til I hit the park, can't wait.

Man now thats a sweet report, really makes me want to get out and do something like that and Im lazy  .  How do you find your way to these spots that far in  the bush?  I would be afraid of getting lost.  I guess you have some good maps and a gps?  Really looks peaceful and beautiful.  Must be nice knowing that you are the only ones around for miles.  Ever any problems with wildlife?  Once again fantastic report.

man sounds like a great trip...when you first planned the trip did it take you a long time to choose a place, I went to algonquin 2 summers ago and got skunked 2 long days of fishing so it has made me not wanna go back up.  Just curious as to what steps you took to plan to hit certain lakes.
beauty report bro
Great rport and pic's, thanks...

Great report there.  You're making my mouth water with the fish fryin' up there.  My father spent some time in the Algonquin Park a few years back, just taking some wildlife and scenery snapshots. I can see why he liked it there.  Never did a camping trip like that and I'll bet I'm missing out on some great fun.   Thanks for posting.
Beautiful report!
Algonquin..........yah gotta love it!!   Great report and pics!
You did super on the trip and on the report, Bud. Great memories for everyone I'm sure.   ps. If some people on this board had their way, not everyone would be able to see this great report.
great pics
Great report, I can't wait for vacation; back to Algonquin!
nicely done cookslav!
Great report, story well told, thanks for sharing.  BTW I know that Giraffe....
Great report... really whet my appetite for my camping trip to Algonquin next weekend! 007
Now that's a report  Thanks
AWESOME REPORT  Nice to see many family members getting together.I love the shot of the young 11 yr old PRICELESS. WHAT A NICE PLACE.
thats a great report, thanks for sharing your trip with us!
Super report and pics.  Felt like I was there.  Joey
Looked like a GREAT trip and great memories, and at least you beat the fire ban. Rusty the rooster isn't hanging out with that giraffe is he.....
Awesome report!!  Looks like a blast!  Great point Roy, that would be a shame...
Wow what a wonderful sounding trip even if the fishing was a bit off.  One of these days I've gotta convince some friends that its worth the trip.
What a great report!  Thanks for taking the time to share it with us.
great report and awsome pics     Peps

The Big Swede deems this report worthy  Nicely done bud! If you can ever find me a nice patch of soft moss to rest my head and more importantly, get those fish to start biting, I may just have to join you guys so we can get the band back together again!

Now that`s a Great report... Looks like you got into some nice fish and the weather was an added bonus... Just wondering on the beer bottle picture???  I thought you weren`t allowed to bring in glass containers???  Doug
